text: To be fair the guy is mostly not wrong, his experience is very typical, only a small percentage ever make it pay. I think he's right to call out Bet Angel as well, their marketing is certainly misleading and arguably exploitative.

text: I’ve thought about doing a competitor to BA with a take I think they’re missing. As part of my research into that I looked at BA a little more closely in terms of where they’ve ended up in the market. I’m not sure their marketing is particularly sound. “Misleading” is a strong term, but it’s definitely “optimistic” in its framing. That thread is frankly terrifying in its tone from that perspective.

text:
Have we skipped over the 3rd person reference in post 2?

As someone whose used xtrader for many years it was always slightly jarring that someone claims they invented the ladder for markets rather than just copied a good idea and put it over a new market.
